availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Lawrence County, Kentucky farm hand and infantry officer. Kentucky native. Officer in Company H, 14th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment, U.S.A., from 1861 to 1863. First Lieutenant from January 1863 to March 1863.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, p. 77. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, Louisa, p. 27. Case Files of Approved Pension Applications of Widows and Other Veterans of the Army and Navy Who Served Mainly in the Civil War and the War with Spain, compiled 1861-1934, Fold3, application no. WC141734. Historical Data Systems, comp., U.S. Civil War Soldiers and Profiles, 1861-1865. “G. R. B. Chapman,” Find A Grave, July 1, 2014, Memorial no. 132168650.
